page.title: 04Keeping Sheep at Home
page.content: To start off with you need quite a bit of pasture fenced off, some sugar beet pulp for the winter when grass is short, a kind heart and some money. We got our two sheep for Â£15 each when they were three months old and we've had them ever since. They are sheared once a year, round about the time of June, and also dipped so that they submerge in a kind of disinfectant which kills parasites like ticks and lice. We usually sell our wool to local spinners for about Â£10, which is a very generous price, because the Wool Marketing Board give 75 pence per kilo for the wool from our type of sheep. They are Jacob sheep with a black and white fleece. It is better to have two sheep rather than one, so that they can keep each other company. We take them around in our car, but with a lot a lorry would be better.
